runs.comm: full, outside off, swinging back in. Ahmadi lets it go
on a length, outside off, slight hint of shape back in, left alone
full and swinging back in, he just feels for it outside off, and gets a bottom edge between the keeper and slip
big inswinger, beats his inside edge, has hit him on the pad after beating him comprehensively. Missing leg here
short of a length, into the armpit, drops it wide of short leg for one
full, swinging in, pushed wide of mid-on, they come back for the second. It's the keeper's end where the danger exists, but the throw arrives at the non-striker's end
full, into the pads, he misses out on some runs and is hit on the pad
lovely outswinger, just outside off, Ahmadi stays on leg and swings. Beaten
more swing there, Ahmadi is not getting close to the line of the ball and swings. Beaten again
short, into the body, short-arm pulled to long leg for one
full outswinger, middle and off, shaping towards off, defended back to him
another full outswinger, pushed to cover
wide length ball, he swings at it with no foot movement. Wafting at it from outside leg. Beaten as expected
action replay of the previous delivery. Not fancying get close to the line of the ball
short of a length, this time he gets behind the ball and runs it down to third man
lovely inswinger. Starts just outside off. 149ks, swinging back in towards off and middle. Gets the inside edge onto the pad
full inswinging yorker, 150ks, on off and middle. He has just about got the bat down in time
on a length, on off, angles away after shaping to swing in. Defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, no feet as he pokes at it. Beaten
fuller, but too straight, defended to mid-on
pushes at a wide length ball away from the body, makes a good connection, gets three through cover. But for Warner's chase, this is four
Ghani covers the swing here, and places this full ball wide of cover for two
bouncer, over middle and leg, he ducks under it
gets inside the line of a length ball and pushes it through midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, nearly chops it on as he looks to dab at it. Gets a single
bouncer, just outside off, he sways out of its line
short of a length, just outside off, left alone
full, just outside off, caressed past cover for two
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a couple
swinging back in towards off, runs off the inside half of the bat for a single
nice delivery. Angling in, then swings away late, beats the drive. Unlucky not to get the edge
short ball down the leg side. Easy call on the wide
fuller but the line is still wrong. Another wide
pushes at a wide length ball, thick-edges it through gully
full, into the pads, defended to leg
full, middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
on a length, angling in, defended from the crease
driven down the ground but straight to mid-on
off the thigh pad, but Johnson's pace means there is no chance for fine leg. Pitched outside leg, and holds the line
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
wide down the leg side as Johnson looks for a bouncer
full and straight, swinging back in a touch, Ghani gets the bat down in time, hits it well, but there is a short straight midwicket in place. Sharp catch but straight at him
beaten for pace first up. Swinging in, hits the thigh pad, then the arm
more swing and pace, gets an inside edge onto the pad
full outside off, swinging back a touch but not enough to threaten the stumps. Left alone
short of a length, outside off, he just heaves at it, gets a thick edge over cover
that is a powerful hit back down the ground but he has hit Mangal at the non-striker's end. No time to get out of the way
bouncer, at his throat, he looks to ramp it over slips, but is beaten

and this was long due. Ahmadi has not been fancying getting behind the line of the ball. Hazlewood bowls short of a length, Ahmadi is away from the line and just opens the face. Easy enough catch head high for Clarke at second slip
digs this one in short, Stanikzai looks for the cut, and is beaten by the extra bounce
into the pads, beats the inside edge but will concede the leg-bye
on a length, quick, just outside off, defended from the crease
lovely shot and excellent fielding. Short of a length, outside off, cut away, and Warner flies at point to field this
dug in short, he is late into the pull, but gets a couple off the bottom edge
looks to hit this one into the Swan after making room. Gets an inside edge onto his body. Loses all shape while trying to hit
another similar slog, thick inside edge this time, Maxwell fields at short leg
pushes this across him, wide
another big swing from Stanikzai, beaten outside off
on a length, on off, he moves across to defend to leg
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
on a length now, around off, Mangal gets right behind it to defend
lovely off-drive to get off the mark. Gets close to a length ball just outside off, extends his arms into it, and sends it straight of mid-off
full and straight, driven hard into the pitch and then it bounces over Hazlewood's head. Using the fabled WACA bounce to his own advantage
bouncer to end the over, Mangal ducks it
wide length ball, he finally connects with the hard swing. Still a mis-hit. Over point it goes for two

lovely catch by Smith. Great hands he has. Stanikzai swings hard again, gets a thick edge that flies towards third man. M Marsh is the man running in, and this should be his catch, which is what Smith believes too, but Marsh doesn't look too keen. Smith goes back into the catch. There can be a collision. Smith catches it over his shoulder, arches back. A collision is avoided. Catch is taken
short of a length, gets behind it and defends
bouncer, headed towards the head, fends at it, but manages to keep it down
wide length ball, swings away too, beats the outside edge as he defends
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
swept from just outside leg for a single to short fine
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off for one
no turn as he looks to defend. Beats the inside edge. Headed down leg, though
full, on off, pushed back to him
short of a length, middle and leg, turned around to short fine leg
plays a forward-defensive, looking for the turn, is hit on the inside edge
on a length, outside off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, on off, gets an inside edge onto the pad
length ball, middle and leg, he likes this gentler pace, he clears the front leg and lofts this over midwicket for a six
one more six. He gives this gentle length ball the treatment after clearing the front leg again. This time, though, he goes over square leg
wide length ball, the best shot of the lot, driving this past cover for three. All along the ground
yorker outside off, he fails to make contact but it has burst through Haddin for four byes
short of a length, punched down to long-on
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
on a length, turning in, hits the inside half of the defensive bat
looks to give him the charge, sees this is bowled flat, punches him past cover for two
length ball, he rocks back to cut, but doesn't manage good timing
full, middle and leg, hit straight to midwicket
bouncer. In front of his face. He sways out of its line
short and wide, cut away to third man
full outside off, pushed to mid-off
moves inside the line to work this length ball for a single
short, wide, cut away in front of square, gets four despite a flying chase from Warner. The front of the hand has touched the ball and the back of it the rope at the same time
bouncer, but too high, called a wide
wide length ball, left alone
down the track, not to its pitch, pushed to long-on
tossed up on off, defended
flighted on middle and leg, defended back to him
this flighted delivery dips a little on him. Dug out to cover
low full toss, driven to long-off for one
low full toss, paddled fine of fine leg for two
driven wide of mid-off where Johnson misfields
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, holds its line outside off, beats the outside edge
rising towards the chest, off his feet as he fends
short of a length, outside off, punched away to deep cover
slogs at a length ball, beaten
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
flighted on off, stays back to punch it to point
flighted around off, pushed back to Clarke
tossed up even higher, driven to long-on
tossed up on off, pushed to cover
flat delivery, swept away to long leg for one
wide length ball, left alone. Called wide
length ball outside off, left alone
another leave outside off
pushes at a wide length ball, and is beaten
looks to work this shortish delivery to leg, gets a soft leading edge towards point. Really high part of the bat too
chest high, and hits him in the chest too. Sami has no idea about this bouncer. Doesn't show any pain
lovely shot. He has been given two short ones, not comes the fuller one to see where his feet are going. They are going forward. And the hands are driving this between the bowler and mid-off
tossed up outside off, looks for the big drive, is beaten
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
looks to sweep, gets some bat on this but finds short fine leg
Clarke has a wicket took. Another sweep. To a length ball. Gets a top edge for an easy catch at short fine leg. His first ODI wicket since September 2012
on a length, holds its line just outside off, defended off the front foot
flighted outside off, defended to cover

lovely catch by Finch. Short of a length, just outside off, he has opened the face on it, everybody is looking towards third man to cut it, but Finch from first slip has gone flying to his right and pouched this. Goes two handed, but it gets stuck in one hand
bouncer, just outside off, left alone. Haddin collects head high
fuller ball, outside off, 144ks, he feels for it, and is beaten
full, slower ball, wide down the leg side
full outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
wide length ball, allowed to go through to the keeper
short of a length, outside off, punched to point
yorker, just outside off, dug out back to his right, and Faulkner fields in his follow-through
full and straight, just outside off, defended to cover
on a length, angling in towards off, defended back to him
angling in, worked away off the pad for a single around the corner
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease. He slips as he tries to change direction in his follow-through. Seems fine
full, outside off, opens the face, gets a single wide of cover
uppishly punched away to third man for a single
full, away swinger from the left-hand batsman, beats him as he pushes away from the body
bouncer now, called a wide for height as he sways out of its line
length ball outside off, pushes at it with an open face
length ball, pitched outside leg, easily deflected away past midwicket for a couple
bowls that armpit ball now, Najib fends but it falls safely back onto the pitch
drives at a length ball, off the inside half this goes to mid-on
length ball outside off, stays back to push this to deep cover for one
on a length, outside off, pushed to cover
length ball, angling in, defended from the crease
bouncer, middle and leg, he sways out of its line
on a length, middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
on a length, middle and leg, defended

Nabi has reviewed this. Nabi looks to paddle, Clarke is running back towards short fine, then he realises Nabi has got a soft edge, and he runs back in towards the stumps to catch this. Nabi says this has come off the arm. He is right, it has come off the arm, but after hitting the top edge. And oh by the way, the snicko has not registered anything even though there is a clear edge here
length-ball offbreak, beats the inside edge, but it is headed down leg
turning in again, but from around middle and leg and going down leg
short of a length, outside off, just a bit of straightening, pushed to cover
stays back to defend a length ball. A wicket-maiden
short of a length, angling in, he looks to work it to leg, gets a leading edge towards cover, but it falls short
slower ball, on the pads, worked away for a single
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
on a length, on off, defended to cover
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to him
length ball angling across him, he gets a thick edge wide of the second slip
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, punched to cover
slashes at a shortish ball, gets a thick edge wide of slip and fine of short third man
short of a length, middle and ff, turning away, defended with an open face
lovely shot. Short of a length, goes back to punch it between point and cover-point
another lovely shot. Down the wicket to take this on the half-volley and drive this straight down the ground and bisect mid-off and mid-on
bouncer, just outside of,f he stays inside the line
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
wide full ball, pushed between point and cover-point
short of a length, pitched outside leg, beats his attempt at the flick and hits the pad
bouncer, over his left shoulder. He ducks it. This is a no-ball for he has overstepped
wide outside off as he goes for the slower ball
full and outside off, hit hard, but straight to mid-off
wide length ball, defended to cover
tossed up outside off, pushed wide of point for one
short of a length, middle and leg, defended
short of a length, spinning in, punched to mid-on
flighted outside off, defended to leg
stays back to defend a flat offbreak
tosses this up wide, left alone
full and fast and swinging. Beats the inside edge but this is headed down leg
short and wide this time, cut away for a single to third man
on a length, dips on him, swings away, beats the outside edge
on a length again, just outside off, he defends from the crease
length ball angling in, pushed to midwicket
wide length ball, Zazai has nothing to do with it
too straight, middle and leg, defended easily to leg
jumps out of the crease, beaten in the flight, gets a thick edge over short third man
some of Maxwell medicine back to him. Down the wicket, almost halfway down the pitch, and swings hard at this. Big big six over long-on. In the second tier
flighted around off, defended with an open face
full offbreak, defended to midwicket
ofbreak, pitches middle and leg, turns back in to beat the inside edge. No appeal for leg-before. They reckon this is headed down leg
Starc and his yorker. Swinging in towards the base of the middle stump. At 148ks. Under the toe end of the bat. Too good for Najib
another yorker, just outside off. Dawlat is backing away
bouncer this time as DZ backs away. He looks to run this down to third man but is nowhere near the ball
length ball, angling in, beats DZ, but the WACA bounce carries it over
it was a matter of time with Dawlat backing away every ball. Out comes this dipping yorker at 151ks at the base of off. Too good again
on a length, angling in, worked away off a single to break the maiden. Two wickets off
yorker outside off, beats his attempt to get some bat on it
another yorker just outside off, and he squeezes it out for one
short of a length, on off, runs it down to third man for one
looks to pull from outside off, the ball is too quick for the shot, goes to mid-off
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
full, on off, dug out wide of mid-off for a single. Starc won't mind it. Brings Hassan back on strike
length ball, on off, holds its line, beats the outside edge
wide on the crease, makes him play the angle, and then gets it to hold its line and beats the edge
full, on off, draws the edge, which falls short of first slip. This is Haddin's catch, but he hasn't gone for it
full and quick, just outside off, Hassan backs away and drives. Beaten
squeezes out a yorker from outside off to take a single to third man
short of a length, angling, worked away for a single to square leg
short of a length, outside off, left alone
bouncer, middle and leg, he ducks under it
yorker, middle and off, Zazai keeps it out
on a length, outside off, left alone
wide down the leg side
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
length ball outside off, pushed back to him
full outside off, left alone
full outside off, pushed to cover
short of a length, angling in, worked to leg for a single
short of a length, angling in, right behind it in defence
yorker, on off, dug out to leg for one
short of a length, outside off, takes the outside edge, but it falls short of second slip
on a length, middle and leg, defended to leg

they don't have a review left, and he has to walk back even if he has not edged it. This is short of a length, outside off, nips back in, goes between the bat and him. Haddin takes the catch. Australia are pretty confident they have got the edge, but Zazai is not walking until the umpire raises the finger. Snicko registers a small little spike
short of a length, on off, Shapoor backs away to hit, but is beaten
Smith has dropped it in front of Clarke. Really full, on off, draws the edge. Smith from third slip goes diving in front of Clarke at second. Puts it down
makes room to defend this to cover
short of a length, just outside off, beats his outside edge
length ball outside off, punched away to point
full and straight, pushed past mid-off with a straight bat
a simple catch at short midwicket ends it. The biggest win WCs. This is short, gets on to him quicker than he expects it, gets a soft edge on the pull, and Johnson collects his fourth wicket
